intro: Pratia begonifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf begonia, is a tropical perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and prefers well-draining soil. Pratia begonifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and ease of care.
